intro: Codonoboea caelestis, commonly known as the celestial codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
